HZic-uVKTjGN4OqCd4Nl1w.text: Ate here on Friday after reading all the reviews on here. I was really disappointed. 1) the staff are so busy you get no  attention. they are ran off thier little feet pegging around, pointing people to tables, launching a menu at you, it feels like you don't have time to catch your breath! 2) the food: I just didnt think it was all that to be honest:We had prawn toasts ( hardly any prawn to be seen)Chicken Satay: chicken not seasoned and had a strange texture Chicken green curry: it was ok, probably a bit more bitter than I was expecting but okRice :perfect ( not everywhere gets this right) Sweet & Sour chicken (pretty good, but not amazing) Such a shame as others obviously have great experiences but we didn't and sadly we wont be returning.

QNh9G-sIzmGXclgmDt51tg.text: I love thai. I love places right near my house that do a super quick takeaway. But I do not love Taste of Siam. I must say, I have not dined in for some time, but I have been disappointed several times now with the takeaway. One the rice comes in plastic... yes, I know it might keep it stickier - but it feels so wrong paying nearly 3 pounds for something that is in plastic. Two the mains are really small for the price. I paid over 10 pounds for some prawns, there was no sauce and it really wasn't enough for a main meal. On the plus side it is quick, but maybe a little too quick (ref: rice in plastic) and I'd probably rather walk a block and wait an extra 5 mins if it meant more reliable quality and taste to boot. Now... where to go when I get a lemon grass craving?!!

vRYedneiaCwxKKXOuLYL9Q.text: Very nice. Best Thai Iced Tea I've ever had, Pad Se Yew was great. My appetizer was amazing, but I haven't the faintest  memory what it was called - it was basically a coconutty shiu mai (pork + prawn dumpling) with hoisin sauce. Prices were great.

6lRVLn6147HOx5Kij5oG7A.text: Great little restaurant that gets very busy around lunchtime. Taste of Siam accomodated our lunchtime party of twelve with no fuss and the speedy service meant we were all fed, watered and out within an hour. The food is absolutely delicious (I'd certainly recommend the Pad Thai), comes in generous portions and, with most mains available for around £5 including rice where necessary, represents really good value. The only niggle was that the service, while generally quick, was a bit erratic with one end of the table getting their drinks and food before the other had even got drinks and there were a couple of us left waiting a little too long for our food whilst the others tucked in. Will definitely be going back and the adjacent supermarket is a great touch when lunch has inspired you to try your hand at Thai food!

RPCNH5FSKQ3jvI33EDJH_w.text: I LOVE this place! I used to work in Camden and would eat lunch here at least once a week. My favorite dish is the Pla Chu Chi, which is basically fried fish in a delicious coconut curry sauce - so yummy! The basics are also good. The service is also usually very good. Not friendly, but fast and efficient.I also had dinner here a few nights and for some reason the quality seemed to not be quite as good. You would think it would have been better since I had been drinking!If you are in the neighborhood, definitely worth a visit!!

CJ8BG_oRsy4SBM7mj3pwWg.text: Great food at reasonable prices.  Nice staff but not overly friendly. Green chicken curry is my favourite. They now have the restaurant, a noodle bar and Thai grocery store all at same location in Camden.

hEEGCcGn9LsXw7NPsN3FFA.text: Good food as long as you don't order vegetarian. The curries are delicious and spicy. It must have been a busy night for them because the service was pretty poor. Although once you do order your food it takes only moments before it arrives. If you're in the area and want Thai it's a good place, but I wouldn't suggest going out of your way for it.

D3U9oMkWa132lZNxDQJzGQ.text: Great place for lunch. And great place for dinner. The Neur Krapraw is my favourite and the spring rolls are pretty good.Usually during lunch the main course might as well arrive before the starters, but it doesn't really matter. Great place :)

4lF4FQjYG5zOQmTrCA1SMw.text: This place is absolutely amazing. Perfect food at incredible prices and probably the quickest and most attentive service I have ever seen in any restaurant. As far as quality to price goes, they are excellent. I really wish I would have known about this restaurant earlier!

0dtsAkbjW-4yW2nBSNbgPA.text: Simple, non-pretentious restaurant with polite and attentive staff. The food is of a consistently high standard. Seafood dishes are fantastic, my 9 year old Nephew can't get enough of the Spicy Squid. Visitors with food allergies will be pleased to hear that the serving staff and chef understand this issue and will customize dishes accordingly. In the adjacent store they also run a great grocery store that stocks Thai, Japanese, and other Asian ingredients. Take-away service is also available.

YsCr0sWhzL9ayzE5UMGD1Q.text: Simple and small, the food came out faster than you can say Pad-Thai.  Ordered a curry which was good, but nothing to write home about.

weufOiM4_sFDiSfk674E3A.text: As a Sydneysider recently relocated to London, I've been going through Thai food withdrawal symptoms. It happens to most of us here apparently. So I went to Taste of Siam simply because I needed a fix and I thought that with this restaurant being attached to its own Thai grocer it may well be somewhere near authentic. I hoped the restaurant would make its own curry pastes and that there would be larp (chilli-hot, limey salad of hand-minced chicken, pork or fish), which is a particular fetish of mine. In my opinion, tom yum is the benchmark for any Thai restaurant worth its salt. This dish encapsulates what I love about Thai food: it's at once exciting and satisfying and, oddly, gives you the impression that you are being nourished in a healthful way. Perhaps it's the liberal use of herbs that purports the health-benefits, or perhaps it's the almost vindictiveness of the chilli hit in many dishes. The tom yum koong at Taste of Siam was a respectable soup. It contained slices of fresh galangal, lemongrass, kaffir lime leaf, fresh chilli and Thai basil. If the straw mushrooms were replaced with buttons, that was okay, at least the prawns were fresh and plump rather than rubbery pink tyres. And best of all, the broth wasn't made of a paste. Similarly the som tam was on a superfluous of mixed lettuce yet was hot with chilli, fresh and clean (with a minimum of dank, yet exciting, dried/salted prawns). Unfortunately mains were less on the money. I asked for a recommendation for something hot with chilli and got suggested the beef with chilli and basil - fair enough. However it turned out to be pretty bland and prepared in the manner of suburban Chinese takeaways with tenderised beef and Cantonese-style chopped onion and pepper. Which I have nothing against, just not in my Thai. Similarly the lamb mussaman was competent, however it was neither as unctuous or as generous with velvety potato as the best style of the dish is - and the meat was off the bone. All fine and dandy I suppose but nothing to write home about. Competent. I will be back when I need a fix of tom yum and I need it now and close by. However I will continue my search for better Thai in London.

ugUtci_B13tzJ65lmkJvFA.text: Quality food and the price is good for lunch time meals. However sometimes I feel they are trying to save some money by not putting enough praws into the seafood dishes. It always has just about 3.

hgBxQoVmC66sxc2BOhsS_g.text: Have been looking for a good thai place for a while now - not sure why it's been  difficult  but this place didn't disappoint! Good prices, great red curry and sweet and sour chicken - loved the thai iced tea. Service was very quick and quite friendly.  I'll be back! :)

I3_9pray96bRq-hQzMY9Vw.text: I was just about to give up on good Asian food here in Camden, when luckily one of my flatmates suggested Taste of Siam. Bingo! I was smitten at first bite with my Pad See Iw, and I guarantee I'll be back for more. I feel like I've literally hit the jackpot with this place. It's inexpensive, it's good, and it's done right. They're service is good too, they don't rush you and they're diligent about filling up your water- not bad for a place in Camden if you know what I mean.

lNZ27O61QsDO93g7Jx4oZQ.text: Excellent fried rice!  Pad see ew was a little too oily, but still worth the price

5fwtauw2HzzRLrUNt1TkNg.text: What it lacks in looks it more makes up in taste. I go there regularly with friends, or by myself, which may have been awkward had it been a glitzy restaurant. Solid performer.

8uihs3m8aafmg6Kt4iQ3Lw.text: Ordered a mix of starters and a green curry, starters were ok and the curry was thick and tasty, most waiters are thai, but the atmosphere is not the cosy thai one you would expect, rather the noisy cafe.

z_ISdIdmXARz6PJCOP0adQ.text: Wanted to recreate the amazing food I had in Thailand, got a great book, and then panicked when saw the variety of ingredients needed to make even the most 'simple' soup. Happily, my flatmate pointed out the Thai supermarket just round the corner (which I had never noticed before...). The shop is attached to a restaurant of the same name, and as it supplies it I assume the restaurant is good! The shop has a really good range of fresh Thai ingredients - I was really impressed to see both holy and sweet basil, galangal, three different types of chilli, Thai baby aubergines, Thai long beans and a variety of other veg which you just can't buy in a British supermarket, but which are essential for proper Thai food. The rest of the shop is packed with tinned and frozen goods, and also stocks Japanese and Korean brands. All of this reasonably priced - not dirt cheap but a lot of the stock is imported and sold in small quantities. I now go to this place at least once a week to pick up a few different ingredients, and always will find something new that they hadn't stocked - or I hadn't noticed - before. Located nearer the Mornington Crescent end of Camden High Street.

D30Gh8S08VBQ76PZGvaBwg.text: Honestly a bit disappointed in the food here. I got the BBQ chicken and it was just a plain grilled chicken, no extra flavor or relish. I think it was just microwaved chicken basically. It was quite busy though - so I'm guessing the hot pots are really good and that they are the reason why people go here.

zuAUzsuBbhoEko_aYq6yog.text: Very bad service, don't know of this is because we are Asian but not from Thailand....The story is we specifically tell the waiter one of us don't eat beef, so we want to change the beef curry to chicken curry, but guess wt we got ~ beef! Then we call the waiter back, and explain that we did change the order when we were taken the order, but he still trying to argue that, we did not change! How can we forget to change when there is a friend can't eat beef!!! Wt I don't like, is they trying to argue with the customer, FYI, service fee is automatically included in all order. The price is OK, but with really small portion.... So my tip is, if ur Asian but not from Thailand, u may want to avoid this place.

Vbi8MFU7e--AjDNXkWAJoA.text: == Secret amazing Thai food alert ==Taste of Siam's snack bar, not the restaurant - the one two doors down -  the one that normally does noodles and sandwiches... well they also do something very special for Thai food, something rarely served outside of Thailand..JIM JOOM! It's not on the English menu, it's only written in Thai, but if you just remember to say those two words - JIM and JOOM - then you'll get served just right and will be royally happy. Jim Joom is Thailand's version of Shabu Shabu, or Chinese Hot Pot. It's actually not from all over Thailand but from the spicy hot region of Isaan, close to Cambodia and Laos and famous for good food.The Jim Joom served at Taste of Siam is never-ending. For real. For £12.50 per person you get a boiling hotpot of galangal and lemongrass soup in which to cook massive plates of raw chicken, beef, squid and prawns. You also get tofu, noodles, an amazing selection of expensive mushrooms and a whole BASKET of herbs and vegetables. The morning glory is beautifully fresh. That's a lot of great food, with some gorgeous spicy dips too. But one of the amazing things is that if you run out of anything, just ask for more and its free. It really is never-ending. I promise you your gut will give up first. You'll be so full you'll be in drunk love with everything.Just check out my photos if you don't believe me.Also... they did the best Thai iced coffee I've had in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Taste Of Siam - London, United Kingdom. Jim Joom. Just ask for it.

iD-AjsPvhe3XSLp5e7P_hQ.text: Had the pad thai, quick, cheap and delicious. I will come back again!

UGkf1aNCLlK1VLugEwgP0w.text: I thought my meal here was great.  And I LOVED the fact that when I ordered my curry spicy hot, they followed through on it; no white girl treatment here!A friend suggested we meet here for dinner, and we were all pleased with the result.. tasty food without breaking the bank.My red vegetarian curry was tasty, spicy and basically everything I wanted it to be.. a few more pieces of tofu would have made it perfect.  I ordered the egg-fried rice as an accompaniment, and thought it was simple yet very tasty.  My hot & sour mushroom soup was just okay, and my lemon and ginger tea warmed me up just as I intended. I did not try anything of my dining partners' except for my husband's aloe vera beverage.  How have I never had this before?  Refreshing and delicious!  I will definitely be seeking out this drink in the future!Service was efficient and friend enough to take a picture of us.  I would come back to Taste of Siam if in the area again, and I would recommend it to anyone who likes good Thai food and doesn't want to pay more than £10 for a meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Taste Of Siam - London, United Kingdom. clockwise: ginger lemon tea, hot & sour mushroom soup, vegetarian red curry, egg fried rice

BWJjpdsYQlYJ2C-64aqnPg.text: I eat a lot of home cooked Thai food and am often disappointed when I find myself at a Thai restaurant expecting similar quality food.However, I feel the Taste Of Siam isn't typical of Thai restaurants in London. On the few occasions that I've eaten here, I've been very impressed. The food doesn't come across as a dulled down euro version dish that you were expecting.The service here is excellent and the decor is pleasant.

RvwCHEV7_VchN0W3Jk7RCA.text: Been here for lunch quite a few times. It has a nice atmosphere with affordable and filling portions of Thai dishes. Definitely worth your time.

TIJiQ7tySxiUciBQUC7z1g.text: Really good food!  Used Yelp to find something to eat while we were in London for 5 days. It was in walking distance of our hotel.  The food was awesome. The service was okay. Not the friendliest staff but I don't need you to be my bff, just bring me my food!  My friend and I liked it so much we took another group back the day before we left. A definite recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Taste Of Siam - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Taste Of Siam - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Taste Of Siam - London, United Kingdom

yObDTZL9KpAyZhIq6zKp9g.text: Excellent, Fresh Thai food. We often eat here and have always been pleased with both the food and service.

AmN7BskHZsxx2vJegv3m7Q.text: I want to give it 4 stars but my friends told me to give it 6 out of 5.  I spent nearly two hours sitting in a restaurant whilst my two friends (who behavioured like mad hatters) who threw in loads of random meats and vegetables in a boiling pot.Don't get me wrong I love hotpot, but when i  have crazy hot-potters  throwing everything they laid their hands on. I got hit by the hot pot liquid three times during the whole dinner. So be careful who you are hot potting. For £12 per head (might have changed since) this place is pretty decent for hot pot.  You get everything from mushrooms, rice noodles, lettuce, chicken, pork, liver, beef, lamb, prawns, squid, egg, baby corn, the list was endless.The sauces were not so great, I ate my hot pot plain.Never tried the other foods on the meal. I think the hot pot is more their speciality.

pRDZmCTy-sJCmbwitvv0_g.text: As a Thai food lover, I always buy take-aways from here because it's very near my home. Great tastes! My personal recommendation is Kao Pad Siam :)

XwIvE_lWa7Y5YV7YB_Dejg.text: I've been wanting to try this place since I moved here as it's only a short walk from my flat, when I looked it their website I saw they had a whole page devoted to their noodle bar, serving noodle soups and... suki/hotpot! 2 of my absolute favourite things! So decided to go there.Came on Saturday night and it wasn't that busy, although they moved us off one table after about 10 minutes because they said it'd been booked. Wanted to order the hot pot but couldn't find it anywhere in the English menu... Thank god for Yelp! After seeing Tom E's review we asked for it and got it, they seemed a little confused, but it was amazing. Amazing. We were on a table for 2 and they had to bring out another little table for ALL THE FOOD. Everyone in the restaurant was eating the hot pot. GO THERE now and eat it. It brought me right back to Thailand, which, lets be honest is where I wish I was 90% of the time. After boiling my food and steaming my face for about 2 hours I left so happy... and pretty much spherical.

XWqRrTojlmDo3S4wP3H7TQ.text: Very tasty food at great prices. Every time I'm in the area I make it a point to visit Taste of Siam. Gets busy at peak times (obviously) but I've never had to wait. I have had most of the menu, and have not been disappointed. Service is great; the waitresses and waiters are speedy and polite. Want a good meal but don't know what to chose? Order the pad thai (I usually order it with tofu which isn't listed on the menu, but they do have it) as a main and the spring rolls as a starter, or the fried crab claws. Their thai iced tea is also pretty amazing. I really don't have anything negative to say, but I have noticed that depending on which 'restaurant' you sit in (there are several of the same restaurant next to one another) I think the chefs are different, so the style of the dishes varies slightly. Oh, and ask for their chili oil--its really tasty!

H5LIImB3g-bnIUmKMqe7MQ.text: My friend (who grew up in Thailand) and I were looking for some good Thai food in London and were happy to find this place. Four of us shared some green curry, two bowls of soup, a duck dish, three bowls of rice, a dish of pad thai, and a fried tofu garlic dish. We paid £35.40 for the whole thing and quite enjoyed what we could finish. We were left with a small amount for one lunch of leftovers.

m0QlUCakuF_5bS54sV7ttg.text: I recently moved to london a few days ago and i was craving spicy thai food really bad. This place did its job calming my craving.Price is very good. Some chicken dish i didnt like but evrything else a little strongly seasoned (then what i am used to. Maybe even salty?) But still good.I tried thai ice tea and that was not good at all. Way too sweet.All in all im happy with this place.

0j65IjEd1JrLVr9tQCo7tg.text: Nice food, specially Prawn dishes and really quick service. I also like how they present you the bill when you want to split, very smart way.

QgKx6QIXBYiVdNHlTzqevw.text: A solid 3 star Thai restaurant. Not great really, but definitely not bad. The large chop to the veggies and meat I find a bit annoying, but that's just my personal opinion. No stars were docked in the formulation of that opinion.  I almost gave an extra star because they had actual Thai eggplant (aubergine) in the curry, but it's just not better than three stars.

swSvkBYXAKqKQpexAZXE1Q.text: Be warned for curry dishes: they overcharge for rice.I've enjoyed all the noodle dishes I've had and yes, they have a flavorful pad thai. It's a good place to meet up with friends and try something new, since the prices are good. Thai iced tea also delicious.

9ODR3uSaunhrqtvu-mymEQ.text: Alexis J, I totally agree with everything you say, although I can't admit to having eaten there for dinner yet. I love Thai food and their green chicken curry (ask for it with coconut rice) is simply one of my favourites. Great value for money (£4.95 at lunchtimes) and if you do work nearby, it's worthwhile going there early as it fills up quickly. Service is efficient, I wouldn't say it's overly friendly but there's nothing to complain about. One of my favourite lunchtime haunts.

nGihRiLrrr-mCVsPBlN-Ww.text: A rather unassuming place, when i arrived there were only two table of couples, so i began to wonder about its popularity. However within 10 mins of waiting the entire restaurant was full to capacity with people waiting for tables. So i felt reassured that my order would arrive fresh and tasteful. Indeed i was not let down as my prawn in rice noodles and vegetables arrived. on the other hand they forgot to bring over my rice, which i had to remind them about. not a major let down and since the food was certainly above average ill still give them a well deserved four stars.Keep up it up guys.

i3UIaHM0fidwmO_jMPwx1A.text: Over the years, I have been here many times.  I have come here time and time again if I want authentic thai, as the food is always good.  There is a lot of choice, lots of curries, even the rice, you can have sticky, coconut or steamed jasmine rice, so cater to all your favourites.  It is always packed and busy.  They have expanded into three restaurants all next door to each other.  One concentrates mainly on hot pots, one with wooden tables and more casual dining, and the other original one with table cloths, and next to it they have their own supermarket where you can buy presumably all that you have eaten in the restaurants too. My favourite dish has got to be the Lamb Massaman Curry, tender lamb and potatoes with coconut milk in a massman sauce.  Just the name makes my mouth water, so yummy.  The lamb is so tender and the potatoes lovely and soft, added to the curry sauce you have heaven in your mouth.If you get a chance, the hot pot dining is also very good and very reasonable.  A great gem at the Mornington Crescent end of Camden High Street.

photos.caption: Photo of Taste Of Siam - London, United Kingdom. The lamb massaman curry - tender lamb and soft potatoes in coconut milk, heaven in your mouth
Photo of Taste Of Siam - London, United Kingdom. Sticky rice comes in its own little rattan container
Photo of Taste Of Siam - London, United Kingdom. The second of the trio of the Taste of Siam restaurants, this one with wooden chairs and tables.

LzpDgYfTd3CRyy9L-6dymw.text: Really darn good Thai food. We ordered it to-go and had a feasty feast at home. The grilled prawns on a stick and veggie spring rolls were decent, and so was the pad woon sen and egg and crab fried rice. The two entrees that really stood out were the pad thai and prawn green curry. YUM! especially the green curry. Really fantastic flavour. The food came out quickly and I was impressed with their many menu options.

photos.caption: Photo of Taste Of Siam - London, United Kingdom. 9- Kung Pao- grilled prawns on sticks
Photo of Taste Of Siam - London, United Kingdom. 78- pad Thai
Photo of Taste Of Siam - London, United Kingdom. 76- Kao pad poo- rice stir fried with egg and crab

koayq-7BRUftJb6_iNTzWg.text: First off, the chicken with peanut sauce (satay) that was ordered was not on the menu as a full sized meal so i had to order 2 appetizer-size meals to create this. However as regards to taste it did work. The rice was good sticky, the sauce was okey sweet and the chicken was cooked all the way through. Not much more to say. The cashew chicken was alright. Not the best combination of herbs and spices, but it was just alright. Nothing more nothing less. It recieves a 2 out of 5 for the unhelpfulness and the subpar and rushed service.

photos.caption: Photo of Taste Of Siam - London, United Kingdom. Chicken with cashew nuts.
Photo of Taste Of Siam - London, United Kingdom. A dinner portion of Satay Gai. Not served in this manner, so i had to combine 2 appetizer-portions of this meal to create this size.

wgSsVX-X7ucrHzDv0fglsg.text: What a gem near Camden Town.  Taste of Siam consists of three adjacent businesses serving up some tasty Thai food.  I have not visited the ayce hotpot shop, but I hear it's really popular especially around the cooler months and is a great value.  I have only been to the traditional Thai eatery which is typically crowded and busy.  There I tried the pad see ew and duck curry which are both phenomenal.  The pad see ew has plenty of wok charred flavor and the curry really impresses with plentiful pieces of tender duck breast and an irresistible sauce that makes you just want to spoon every last drop over rice and eat without breathing until you finish the whole bowl.  Def recommend this place if you're craving Thai and find yourself in the Camden area.

rZsxriBS75pMCs6iKnAAzw.text: Decent food, nothing spectacular. Service was pretty slow, especially considering the part of the restaurant we were in was empty.

FEklCTXE6T-fQjAgGz5S9A.text: Taste of Siam is totally recommended for a decent Thai meal, with friendly, efficient staff, good value for money.This part of Camden has all the fastfood chains and cheap eats and therefore it is not my favourite part of town but ever since I got here I have been doing some of my oriental shopping at the small Thai supermarket next door to Taste of Siam and always wanting to eat something in their restaurant. So I finally did and I am not disappointed at all. Most importantly the food is just really good. The fish cakes, the coconut chicken soup, the green curry, the chilli basil stir fry, it all was very tasty, with the right spiciness to it. On a Tuesday night two of the three spaces they operate in were partially filled with people so it was quite busy which is nice. We were welcomed and directed to a table very promptly and after a quick order because we were rather starving we got our starters very soon. We shared starters so it was perfect they did not come at once, which would have been a bit different if we would have wanted it all together.Just go there if you feel like eating Thai!And don't forget the supermarket next door has some special ingredients if you want to DIY.

4XyngvxbXXCbTW5d7jYEZA.text: A consistently great thai lunch spot that won't hurt your pocket.All your favourite staples for circa £6 (same same, but different)If you're hungry and in the area it really is a no-brainer.The supermarket next door will help you to bring those thai-smiles home.

DIusKruMgr9Ks33JDmucsQ.text: Best Thai food I've had in london by far! Very affordable, quick service, amazing food!!!!

nTO3nIEhDy-qWDTlSAH8FQ.text: Our group of friends came here for dinner before a few rounds of drinks at the pub across the street. Cute little place with nice wait staff and good food. I remember the pad see ew being delicious. There were some appetizers and those were good too. Since I'm irrational I gauge how good a place is by their Thai Tea and theirs was delicious, so case closed. It looked like a former bakery or pastry shop, could've been. It's conveniently located on Camden High Street so there are a bunch of things to check out. It's also just a short walk from the nearest station. Easy enough. All in all, a decent sit-down place. Enjoy!

VO1mU5CqMUJ258OFAK8acg.text: mmmmmm..........Lovely restaurant with flavorful Thai food, but WARNING: Thai ice tea and Thai coffee is EXTREMELY SWEET. Normal Thai food price range with reasonable portions. The tofu starter was mediocre considering that there's just 6 pieces of extremely fried tofu with a very common sweet and sour sauce (topped with garlic but didn't do anything to the flavor) and was charged almost £5 for it. Not gonna order it again. The Pad Thai came so quick that I don't know if I should be impressed or suspicious. It was tasty but lacked the bit of sweetness that Pad thai usually consists. Noodles are not soggy (thumbs up) and prawns were really fresh. Pad see ew was amazing though! The sauce was just at the right saltiness and not too oily. One thing good about this restaurant is that they don't overcook their noodles, meaning I'm probably coming back soon. They also have a great list of curries that is yet for me to try. Oh, and seems like takeaways are pretty popular here as they don't deliver.

photos.caption: Photo of Taste Of Siam - London, United Kingdom. tofu starter and Thai coffee. too sweet
Photo of Taste Of Siam - London, United Kingdom. pad Thai and pad si ew

F0wEbDhy7TkWz1jL2x500A.text: Tasty Thai in the heart of Camden town. The restaurant has 3 different entrances with separate seating areas but all are part of taste of Siam. They also have a specialty thai supermarket located next door. The menu is extensive and authentic. Our server greeted us right away and brought drinks quickly. We didn't waste time ordering. I went with my usual pad thai and the bf tried panang curry. Our food came out very quickly, much sooner than I expected but was hot tasty and fresh. The environment was nice, cozy and clean. We all enjoyed our meals. The server did take a while to bring checks after dinner as it started to get quite busy, however we were still in and out in a jif! Recommended as a good spot for reasonably priced and tasty thai food in a neighborhood that has many many ethnic restaurants to choose from.

photos.caption: Photo of Taste Of Siam - London, United Kingdom

GdHqO9rowbvJQz5hoqHrBg.text: (Restaurant only)For lunch, this place is hard to beat.I've been twice for lunch this year- my 2nd visit happening today.  I got the beef green curry (£4.95) today...though I wished the beef was bit a wee bit more tender, there were really no complaints (I wanted to drink the curry sauce!).  My first visit a few months ago was even better- I ordered their first item on their lunch menu, a curry dish with prawns for £5.95, and it was super-delicious.  Consistently great food with not-so-consistent service...I didn't fancy the elder man's curt attitude that served us today, while the younger woman for my first visit was pleasant.  If they can get those kinks out the way, I may have found my definite go-to for budget Thai food.

photos.caption: Photo of Taste Of Siam - London, United Kingdom. Yummmmm...

PbDs3bNaOvcXUGh1ELwVzg.text: This Thai place was a great find, thanks to Yelp.  It is a small place but the food was delicious - watch out for the spice level, though (the Tom Yum Kung and Tom Yum Kai were spicy and I love spicy). The peanutty taste of the Pad Thai was pleasing and not too sweet.

_uQWhDiKTDuKdgkKXZEA9Q.text: We decided to go to Taste of sian after reading the good reviews and seeing the outrageously low prices. This place is fantastic!!! The service was good, the pad Thai was fresh and flavorful. Great food for the price and definitely worth a trip to Camden town.

photos.caption: Photo of Taste Of Siam - London, United Kingdom

93NJqq5wDELLXG1TQGOGXg.text: Love Taste of Siam!Come here often on my lunch break for the lunch special, which is fantastic value. Huge portions for the amount you pay, always come away full. The Thai curry is amazing. Love the sauce and the rice, and you get plenty of chicken too. Satay skewers as a starter is good too!Really can't fault it as a great lunch deal.

E9y4fifNMnNk68eXjw96zA.text: We grabbed dinner here tonight and the food was very good!We started with the Tom Yum Kai for 4.50 pounds and it was really tasty. I didn't love the taste of the chicken in there but it was fine.My husband had the pad see ew with beef. The beef was very tough but he liked the sauce (it wasn't for me).I ordered the Pad Thai and subbed out the prawns for chicken. I also asked for it spicy and the server was very short with us about that -- he really just wanted to give us the spice dish to add our own. I really am not a big fan of the spice dish, I always feel it tastes better when they add the spice in the kitchen. Luckily, he did finally agree to make it spicy and it was really good - but very spicy so be careful if you're not into that sort of thing.My husband did end up using the spice tray option for his pad see ew (instead of having the kitchen do it) and the spice was very oily.The entrees were 6.50 pounds each. Service was not too friendly.I'd recommend this place.

UYBLmlfNJs_AdcDMcn8Ddw.text: I have been frequenting this place for three years (so I dont know why its taken so long to review it!?)Its made up of three eateries, and an asian food shop. Of the three eateries ive eaten in the noodle bar and the restaurant. The other part is more of an over flow area that sometimes opens for groups.  The food here is by far the best thai ive had in london and its very reasonably priced. The staff are typical thai I.e. very friendly and the food is super tasty. When I have out of towners in, I always take them to this spot as I know the quality it routinely excellent and the price is very "un-london". The menu covers a whole load of different dishes of which ive tried most. Id recommend the massaman curry and the thai beef chili salad.... but everything is good.All three of the eateries are very comfortable and unfussy in decor. This place isnt super posh but for what you pay and what they serve its well worth 5 *'s

7vkv84MC7pjS3loMGjvnFQ.text: The lunch meal is fantastic!  Service is quick and the food is very good.  Highly recommend.

kW3rxidyDItVY5pjOPqlRg.text: Green curry was great, reasonable prices, atmosphere was nothing special...

WL_4Ydsm4Yc-fg-kHJNvAA.text: Taste of Siam is a restaurant and Thai / Asian supermarket next door. This is a review for the supermarket.5 stars because it's the only place where I can find Thai pea aubergines and coriander with roots along with more commonly found items such as galangal, kafir line leaves and other Thai ingredients. Also fresh S. E. Asian vegetables and lots of pastes and sauces for cooking. A small shop but plenty of interesting stock and friendly owner too.
